definitions.Accounting Principles: Generally accepted accounting principles in England, including IFRS
definitions.Affiliate: A Subsidiary of the person or a Holding Company of that person or any other Subsidiary of that Holding Company
definitions.Authorisation: An authorisation, consent, approval, resolution, licence, exemption, filing, notarisation or registration
definitions.Available Commitment: Lender's Commitment minus any outstanding Loans and any Loans due to be made on or before the proposed Utilisation Date
definitions.Business Day: A day (other than a Saturday or Sunday) on which banks are open for general business in London
definitions.Change of Control: More than 50% of the issued or allotted ordinary share capital or more than 50% of the voting rights of the Borrower is acquired by a new owner
definitions.Confidential Information: All information relating to the Company, the Group, this Agreement or the Facility
definitions.Default: An Event of Default or any event that could become an Event of Default after certain conditions
definitions.Disruption Event: A material disruption to payment or communications systems or financial markets required for the Facility, or a technical/systems-related disruption to a Party's treasury or payments operations
definitions.Event of Default: Any event or circumstance specified as such in Clause 14
definitions.Facility Office: The office or offices through which the Lender will perform its obligations under this Agreement
definitions.Finance Lease: Any lease or hire purchase contract that is treated as a balance sheet liability
definitions.Financial Indebtedness: Indebtedness in various forms including moneys borrowed, bonds, debentures, Finance Leases, and receivables sold or discounted

human_readable_highlights.key_economics: The loan amount is £50,000,000 with a term of 12 months from the agreement date.
human_readable_highlights.risks: Potential disruptions in financial markets or payment systems could impact the Facility. A change of control involving more than 50% of the Borrower's share capital or voting rights could trigger an Event of Default.
human_readable_highlights.unusual_features: The definition of Financial Indebtedness includes a broad range of financial obligations, and the Facility includes specific provisions for disruptions affecting financial or operational capabilities.
